allData.occupation: Brand Marketing, Senior Manager at Tepper Sports & Entertainment

positions.title: Brand Strategy & Events, Senior Manager
positions.description: Responsible for project management and overall brand strategy of both Charlotte Football Club & Crown Legacy Football Club, including events, facility development & stadium renovations, brand management, and retail operations for the clubs to elevate awareness, increase fan affinity, generate engagement, and grow revenue for the clubs.

positions.title: Brand Marketing, Senior Manager
positions.description:
• Increased revenue for Tepper Sports & Entertainment’s portfolio of brands through elevated brand awareness, fan affinity, and engagement.
• Maintained brand consistency & supported brand strategy throughout all branded events, facility build-outs, and retail activities.
• Served as project manager with a multi-million dollar budget to build, brand, and program Atrium Health Performance Park, Charlotte FC’s world-class 52,000+ sq ft training facility. Responsibilities included FF&E RFP process, product/finishes selections and all vendor deliveries & installs.
• Directed cross-functional teams to execute large-scale branded events and accompanying promotional campaigns.
• Successfully led international Panthers takeover & watch party in Frankfurt, Germany and the Panthers Head Coach introductory press conference.
• Provided high-level administrative, financial, operational, and project management support to the senior executive staff including short and long-range planning for the organization’s overall business strategy.
• Served as the liaison with the third-party retail operator to ensure stadium store operation, e-commerce and all buying ran smoothly for all teams.
• Worked with both NFL & MLS consumer products divisions, as well as official licensees (Nike, adidas, New Era, Mitchell & Ness, etc.), on product assortment details, custom designs, and approvals.
• Wrote creative requests and collaborated with graphic designers to create a package of assets for all owned and operated digital channels, for merchandise launches and promotions.
• Collaborated interdepartmentally with efficiency and organization to assist the executive team members in determining and prioritizing business strategies, drafting schedules for implementation of long-range plans & proposals, and establishing KPIs.

positions.title: Fan Experience & Events Manager
positions.description:
• Project management lead for all Charlotte FC tentpole events and associated digital campaigns including the franchise-awarding announcement events, virtual brand launch, internal media athlete production days, first-ever Head Coach press conference, jersey launch reveal, and inaugural home opener game via coordinating cross-functional teams of 20+ internal staff and external vendors.
• Developed, marketed, and brought to life the brand identity of a new major league sports franchise through cohesive digital campaigns and experiential activations, each increasing brand awareness and fan affinity.
• Utilized excellent organizational skills, attention to detail, and clear communication to lead projects from ideation to execution through management of group meetings, deadline setting, creative requests, budget tracking, & schedule planning.
• Continually thought innovatively & collaboratively for new ideas and problem-solving, to ensure time was spent on meaningful, ambitious, and progressive activations.

positions.title: Brand Experience, Senior Coordinator
positions.description:
• Developed, planned, and managed all high-visibility branded events including: 
     - Amazon’s All or Nothing: The Carolina Panthers premiere, inclusive of a blue carpet entrance, VIP reception, and showing. Event was the largest premiere in the series’ history.
     - Gameday experiences: Coca-Cola Catwalk gameday player arrival experience, which was featured on ESPN, NFL Network, and selected for the NFL’s Best Practices program; Panthers on Mint gameday street festival.
     - Coordinated special team celebrations such as the Panthers 25th Season kickoff block party; Panthers Hall of Honor dinner and presentation; annual Tree Lighting community event; and annual VIP Training Camp Kickoff hospitality event.
• Developed & produced Covid fan engagement adaptations inclusive of an innovative subscription program & gameday virtual fan rooms.
• Executed all Panthers NFL fan engagement opportunities including League tentpole (NFL Draft, Pro Bowl, and Super Bowl) fan experiences, as well as branding & marketing for the Panthers Madden studio show.
• Operated as the liaison between the marketing department and the partnerships line of business inclusive of developing and managing go-to-market plans for sponsor related programs, events, and activations, as well as contributing to the asset ideation process for sponsor prospect pitches and approving sponsor cobranded assets before production.

positions.title: Corporate Hospitality & Fan Engagement Coordinator
positions.description:
• Planned and managed all hospitality villages, applications, clients, and vendor orders, involving up to 36 simultaneous client experiences per game and generating over $3 million in annual revenue.
• Managed all season ticket member fan engagement programs, events, and giveaways, contributing to a 99% YOY season ticket renewal rate.
• Managed the day-to-day responsibilities of, and delegating work to, 4 full-time employees.
• Selected by leadership to fly in advance with the team to Super Bowl 50 to handle all player and VIP gifting, as well as on-site ticket operations.
